author: Yasmin Khan
title: Kuku-Ye Sabzi (Iranian Herb Frittata)
text:
1 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaf 2 teaspoons sunflower oil 50 grams spring onions, trimmed and finely chopped 2 garlic cloves, crushed Directions 
1. Wash the spinach, parsley, dill, cilantro, and chives, then dry well on kitchen paper or in a salad spinner. Try and squeeze as much moisture out as possible; if the greens are wet when they are cooked, they will make the kuku go spongy. Chop finely or blitz in the food processor, in a couple of batches. 
2. Heat the grill to high. Crack the eggs into a large mixing bowl. Add the turmeric, flour, salt, pepper and fenugreek leaf. Stir in the chopped spinach and herbs. 
3. Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the spring onions and garlic and gently fry over a low heat for 2 minutes to soften. 
4. Make sure the garlic and spring onions are evenly distributed around the pan, then pour in the egg mixture. Cook over a low heat for about 5â€“8 minutes, until the kuku is almost cooked through. Finish off under the hot grill. 
5. Leave to cool slightly, then cut into triangular slices to serve.
